column4: Nasdaq to compensate firms on December 31 for botched Facebook IPO
column5: NEW YORK Nasdaq OMX Group Inc will compensate firms on December 31 for qualifying claims related to Facebook Inc's botched May 2012 initial public offering  the exchange operator said in a note to traders on Friday.

column4: Abbott Labs settles with U.S. over kickback claims
column5: Abbott Laboratories  has agreed to pay the United States $5.48 million to resolve allegations that it paid improper kickbacks to induce doctors to use some of its products  the U.S. Department of Justice said on Friday.

column4: BRIEF-AstraZeneca and Shionogi extend Crestor licence
column5: Dec 27 AstraZeneca PLC :  * And shionogi settle arbitration and extend licence agreement for crestor  * Under the revised terms of the agreement  royalty payments from AstraZeneca to Shionogi has been modified to reduce the effective royalty rate in 2014-2015; the amount of this royalty rate reduction will be a low single-digit number  * Agreement will extend the period of royalty payments from 2016 to 2023 * Source text for Eikon:  * For more news  please click here

column4: U.S. court OKs Bank of America $39 million gender bias deal
column5: NEW YORK A federal judge on Friday approved Bank of America Corp's $39 million settlement of a gender discrimination lawsuit by female brokers over objections that the accord would enshrine bias on Wall Street.

column4: Duke's proposed S. Carolina Lee reactor passes environmental test
column5: Dec 27 U.S. power company Duke Energy Corp's  proposed Lee nuclear power plant in South Carolina passed an environmental test but still has a long way to go to receive a construction and operating license  the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission said on Friday.

column4: GM recalls 1.5 million cars in China over fuel pump bracket
column5: SHANGHAI General Motors Co's  China joint venture is recalling 1.46 million cars due to a defect with the fuel pump brackets  in one of the largest safety recalls in the world's biggest auto market.

column4: UPDATE 3-GM recalls 1.5 mln cars in China over fuel pump bracket

column4: GM to recall around 1.5 mln vehicles in China - regulator
column5: SHANGHAI  Dec 27 China's quality watchdog said on Friday Shanghai General Motors Co Ltd  General Motors Co's  venture with SAIC Motor Corp  will recall about 1.46 million vehicles in China due to issues with fuel pumps.

column4: UPDATE 1-Petrobras platform fire injures 2  cuts some Marlim field output
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Dec 27 A fire at an offshore oil platform operated by Petroleo Brasileiro SA  Brazil's state-run oil company  injured two workers and cut output from one of Brazil's largest oil fields  the company said on Friday.

column4: STXNEWS-Aberdeen sells part of stake in Brazil's Petrobras
column5: UK-based Aberdeen Asset Managers Limited sold 14.88 million preferential shares in Petrobras to reduce its stake in the Brazilian state-run oil company to 4.98 percent  Petrobras said in a securities filing.

column4: Target says PINs stolen  but confident data secure
column5: BOSTON/NEW YORK Target Corp said PIN data of some customers' bank ATM cards were stolen in a massive cyber attack at the third-largest U.S. retailer  but it was confident that the information was "safe and secure."

column4: UPDATE 4-Target says PINs stolen  but confident data secure
column5: BOSTON/NEW YORK  Dec 27 Target Corp said PIN data of some customers' bank ATM cards were stolen in a massive cyber attack at the third-largest U.S. retailer  but it was confident that the information was "safe and secure."

column4: Target confirms encrypted PINs were stolen in recent breach
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 27 Target Corp on Friday confirmed that "strongly encrypted PIN data" was stolen as part of the massive data breach at the third-largest U.S. retailer during the first three weeks of the holiday season.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St trades flat  still on track for weekly gains
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 27 U.S. stock indexes barely budged on Friday  taking a break from this week's rally that has repeatedly pushed stocks to all-time highs as investors close out a stellar year for equities.

column5: NEW YORK  Dec 27 U.S. stocks edged higher on Friday as the market's recent upward bias continued  though investors were reluctant to make big bets after a rally that repeatedly took major indexes to all-time highs.

column4: Textron to buy Beechcraft for $1.4 billion
column5: Textron Inc   maker of Cessna planes  said it will buy aircraft maker Beechcraft Corp for about $1.4 billion in cash  in a deal that sees Textron expand its aviation business.

column4: Toyota recalling more than 400 000 vehicles in Saudi Arabia
column5: Dec 27 Toyota Motor Corp is recalling more than 400 000 vehicles in Saudi Arabia that were produced from 2006 to 2010 due to concerns about unintended acceleration  the company and Saudi Arabia's trade ministry said.

column4: Miley Cyrus says after Disney  it was time to be herself
column5: LOS ANGELES  Dec 27 It is sex  drugs and pop music - and Miley Cyrus is fine with it that way now that the provocative singer has shed her innocent Disney star image along with most of her clothes.
